TextAsset.value: (Wow, it’s awful dark in here.)
(Hope I’m not late.)
(And also that I’m in the right place.)

(But, ALSO also that this is NOT where Tomari lures new kids so they’re isolated and in the dark and no one sees him come up from behind with a giant axe to kill ‘em and no one notices because they haven’t had time to make friends in the community yet!)
(The murdered kids I mean.)
(But, more so, I really hope Tomari doesn’t axe murder anyone actually.)
(Or murder at all in a general sense.)
(WHY AM I FREAKING OUT ABOUT BEING MURDERED??)
(Especially by a goofy guy like Tomari.)
Hi, ${slot:playerName}.
AAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!
Um.
(DEEP BREATH, ${slot:playerName}! YOU WILL LIVE THROUGH THIS!)
You, uh, okay?
YES! THE MOST OKAY AND ALIVE!
You’re yelling though?
AM I? NOT FOR HELP THOUGH!
HAHA!
BECAUSE WE’RE FINE HERE AREN’T WE. Ha! Heh.
Ahem.
What I meant to say, when I screamed in complete primal fear was, “Hey, Tomari.”
Uh, yeah. Glad you could make it! I’m afraid I brought you down here under false pretenses.
(DON’T PANIC)
The engineering club could use some new blood.
(B-B-BLOOD?!?!?)
There’s just Hiromi and me. And, technically, she’s not in the club.
Her motorcycle is.
Whew!
Hm?
Uh. What I mean is, y’know, more club resources for us, AM I RIGHT!
Ha, that’s the spirit! And you are, indeed, quite right!
BEHOLD!
(Wait…what if that’s where he keeps the bodies!!!!)
That’s uh n-n-nice tarp…?
Haha! Not the tarp. What’s underneath it!
And, uh, what would that be exactly?
My secret project.
(MURDER BODIES WOULD BE A BIG SECRET!!!)
I know we just met, but I feel like I can tell you all about it.
Anyway, it’s not like I could keep it secret from a fellow engineering genius like yourself for long anyway!
Haha! That sure is the real truth!
No one but me knows it, but we’re engaged in a robotics cold war with the twisted genius Dr. Kubota from Evil Namco High!
Hang on. His name is Doctor or IS a doctor? And if it’s the second one, then how is he in high school?
How do we have a spaceship student?
Fair enough!
So, evil genius, and robots? That’s bad!
You have no idea, ${slot:playerName}.
NO ONE DOES!
(Whoa, must be serious.)
If Dr. Kubota gains the upper hand, it may very well plunge all of Namco Land into ten thousand years of darkness!
(WHAT!!!)
But now I’ve got a secret weapon.
(Like a murder axe?!)
Your brain!
(My brain?!)
(An axe would be better!)
Only my super robot project can defeat Dr. Kubota’s vile machinations, but it’ll take all our smarts to get it working and save Namco Land from certain doom.
(GULP! What’ve I gotten myself into! I CAN’T BUILD A ROBOT!)
But that bleak nightmare is no longer the inevitable result of current conditions!
Uh, yeah. It definitely isn’t.
Because now Namco High has a shot at winning the Robot Battle Brawl competition.
Wait the what?
Which everyone knows is the most popular sport in the whole school.
(I never heard anyone call it that.)
(Or anything at all, actually.)
(Because no one ever mentions it!)
I calculated the damage to school spirit, morale, and morals of the entire student body if Namco High loses the next Robot Battle Brawl match against Evil Namco High.
${slot:playerName}, it would be disastrous to the power of catastrophic.
I had to invent a whole new word to describe it:
DISASTROPHIC!
Grades plummet, tardies skyrocket, attendance is reduced to a handful of students seeking shelter from the juvenile raider gangs that will band together to roam the wasteland and prey on the weak.
This is the dark future that hangs in the balance.
Heavy is the head that wears the Robot Battle Brawl crown, ${slot:playerName}.
Okay.
Um.
Preeeeeeeeetty sure Wrestleball is the most popular sport in school though?
Wrestleball? Oh, what, just because kids constantly talk about it?
And a ton of them go to the games?
And the practices?
And also play the game, either for the school or for fun at home? And the video game? Or all of the above?
That’s supposed to mean it’s “popular?”
That’s the definition of popular, so yeah.
Well.
Imagine a sport even more popular than that then!
Oof, I’m trying, but wow, it’s not easy!
What if I told you…
…it didn’t need to be imagined?
BECAUSE IT’S ROBOT BATTLE BRAWL!
(It’s cute how into this stuff Tomari is, but he’s a little delusional about it!)
Tomari. If Battle Robo Brawl –
Robot Battle Brawl.
Uh, right, that too.
If it’s so popular, then why are you the only student in the engineering club? Shouldn’t this place be packed?
Oh, that’s easy. I wouldn’t let anyone else join.
Really?
This is war, ${slot:playerName}.
Big stomping robot war!
They’d only get in the way. Just slow me down.
Always wanting help with their own projects. As if I’m not consulting enough students on extra-curricular projects as it is!
Hiromi and her bike, Max and his plane, Principal Dig Dug and his lunar detention rocket…
Wait, there’s a rocket?
Or, THE ABSOLUTE WORST, talking to me.
That’s…bad?
It’s awful. They drone on and on about whatever nonsense people limited to baseline intelligence have the inclination to discuss among their own kind.
I believe a lot of it concerns professional sports statistics and celebrity embarrassments.
And they have the audacity to assault me with it!
We can, in time, solve any problem we put to ourselves with nothing more than hypothesis based on observation.
All because of the mind!
THE MIND, ${slot:playerName}!
The most powerful and versatile tool in the known universe. We’ve all got one, but most people spend their lives acting as if they don’t!
They cultivate distraction in place of wisdom! Trivia in place of knowledge!
(Sheesh, Tomari’s got some intense opinions about, uh, society I guess? He sounds like a supervillain!)
(I mean, he wants to save the world from total devastation, so that’s good. But the devastation he’s worried about isn’t actually a real problem. But he thinks it is!)
(I think he’s a good person, deep down, it’s just all those brains are getting in the way!)
But to answer your question more completely, re: lack of students in the club, you’re forgetting that for the purposes of official club business, Hiromi’s motorcycle counts as a student.
Heck, it gets better grades than Taira!
Okay, well, two students still isn’t all that great though.
So modest not to count yourself!
(Oh, right. Me.)
Yeah. And I’ll contribute.
I’ll contribute BIG TIME.
But I think you may be overestimating the effect the brawling robot battle will have on, uh, the world.
Impossible. I did the calculations myself.
With or without the glasses, I ask purely out of curiosity?
Without, of course.
Yeah, I thought so.
They were confiscated after the explosion.
The...I’m sorry...
The EXPLOSION?
If I’m to be perfectly honest, it was the explosion…
Plural.
Though a case could be made that it was the FINAL explosion, singular, that broke the camel’s back, as it were.
Also about one-third of the plumbing on campus.
And the computer lab.
HOWEVER, I made the case that it wasn’t any of the explosions caused by my experiments that damaged school property!
Rather it was the school’s lack of significantly reinforced infrastructure to withstand explosive forces that ALLOWED it to be destroyed.
It was a brilliant defense, but the administrators weren’t swayed.
Since they couldn’t very well lock up my brain, they confiscated my glasses instead.
Ironically, their short sighted thinking has only exacerbated by short sighted SEEING and all progress on the super robot has come to a halt THEREFORE DOOMING US ALL!
I brought this to the attention of the administration, and was brutally rebuffed.
(Who could have guessed robot brawls and explosions would feature so heavily in the life of a harmless looking bookworm?)
(Hmmm.)
(Maybe I should try to help out just to keep him out of trouble!)
Even so, Tomari, I’m not sure a single high school sports match can plunge the world into ten thousand years of darkness.
Wow, you’re good!
You haven’t even seen the equations, but you immediately intuited that ten thousand years was the worst case scenario.
But, you’re right, there’s a chance we may only have to endure five thousand years of darkness.
Even so, I don’t like those odds. But that’s what you’re here for!
Uh, yeah. Me. I will do stuff right, like, wow.
I bet! Hey, let’s get started.
(ALREADY?!?)
Uh, yeah. Started. That’s what we’ll do. Right now. Yeah. Can’t wait.
Okay, so you fixed the nanofiber locomotive matrix this morning, and you’d think that’d be the end of our problems, but it’s only the beginning!
Swell…
Glad you enjoy the thrill of a challenging project as much as I do, ${slot:playerName}!
(Wonder if I could fake a heart attack…)
(But then Tomari might think he could learn cardiology by practicing it on me!)
(Uh-oh. He’s been talking this whole time…Should I have been paying attention?)
blah blah GN/DN polarity got switched. And I don’t have to tell YOU what that means! My first thought was to blah blah blah
(I HAVE NO IDEA WHAT HE’S TALKING ABOUT!)
(Then again, I still wouldn’t know what he was talking about even if I heard the whole thing.)
(Smile and nod, ${slot:playerName}. Smile and nod.)
(Just gotta keep an eye on this guy so he doesn’t accidentally blow up any more school property. Or himself. It’s not that bad.)
(I mean, he’s kinda easy on the ol’ eye keepin’ itself on him, IF I KNOW WHAT I MEAN.)
(And I do.)
(So, that helps.)
(Uh-oh. I think he’s waiting for me to say something…)
What do you think? Any ideas?
(STALL STALL STALL)
Uhhhhhhhhhh.
(STAAAAAAAAAAALLLLLL)
Yes.
Great.
(Nailed it!)
Yup. It is great.
So, let’s hear ‘em.
(AAAARGH!)
You should…
Uh.
Fix the thing. That, um...
...needs fixing.
Yeah, but which of the three methods I described do you think we should try?
(WHAT? When’d he say anything like that?)
(Oh, right. When I wasn’t really paying attention probably.)
(Okay! I’ll just say, like, “That last one.” I mean, y’know, whatever, they’re probably mostly the same, right?)
Each one has a distinct and unique advantage counterbalanced by an ARBITRARILY DEVASTATING AND EASILY EXPLOITED weakness.
(What?! Why does it work like that?!)
As you know, that’s just how science works.
These factors need to be carefully considered with regard to their potential impacts upon the super robot’s combat capabilities.
(Well. Okay. Still not that bad. If I choose the wrong one, it’s no big deal, right? We’ll just try something else.)
(Yeah!)
AND WE HAVE TO GET IT EXACTLY RIGHT ON OUR FIRST TRY!
(OH COME ON ALREADY!!!)
Dr. Kubota could attack at any moment. We can’t risk being half done with our second or third try when he does!
Yeah. That would be a disaster!
(Oh crap oh crap what do I do!)
(What am I saying? It’s just a silly high school rivalry in a sport no one cares about anyway. It doesn’t matter what I pick!)
Uh, let’s do the first one.
The first one? Are you sure?
Uh, no? Yeah, let’s go for the last one.
Really? That one?
Well, I mean, y’know, the second one then maybe.
I feel like there’s something you’re not telling me, ${slot:playerName}.
(He’s on to me! BETTER SAY SOMETHING FAST!)
Do that thing with the part that doesn’t work how you want and make it good!
(Yeah! That sounded sufficiently technical!)
But...it’s not one part that isn’t working, it’s a whole subsystem and there’s a few ways to approach it.
YEAH I KNEW THAT!
Hmm…
I think I know what you’re getting at, ${slot:playerName}…
You’re saying I’ve gone about the problem all wrong!
Um.
Yyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy
Nnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn
Yyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyeeeeaaah…
I’m...I’m not used to speaking with someone who can operate at my own level.
Haha! Yeah, I know what you mean.
(I mean, kind of!)
So, which part do you think it is that’s causing all the trouble?
Ah. Yes. That’s. Hm. Yes, that’s a question.
We should answer it!
With information. Hm. Yup. Yeah.
Sounds like you’re suggesting we do some research.
(Ah-ha! He can’t accidentally blow up anything if we’re just reading books in the library!)
(And, who knows, maybe I’ll pick up some of this engineering stuff while we’re there. This could turn into a pretty cool thing for us to do. Yeah!)
The research. Yes! That.
Great! It’s a little late to start on that now, but I’ll get a reading list together and we can hit the books tomorrow!
Yes. Super.
Uh, see you then, Tomari.
(He’s not so bad once you get him to open up a little.)
(I mean, okay, he’s still crazy. But it’s a cute kind of crazy.)
(Well. Until there’s explosive experiments, I guess...)
(But we’re gonna work on that!)
